views:
**Anonymous volume** - `docker run -v /app/data`


**Named Volume** - `docker run -v data:/app/data


**Bind Mount** - `docker run -v /path/to/code:/app/code`

Anonympus

- can not be shared accross container
- removes on container delete


Named volumes

- shared across containers
- can be re-used for some container
- survives container shutdown / restart
- not tied to one specific container

Bind Mounts

- location on host file
- survives container shutdown

`docker volume ls` shows anonymous and named volume

`docker volume create <volume-name>` and can be assigned to a container


`docker volume  inspect <name>` - to see the cotainer its mount on and the read/write option

`docker volume rm <name>` to remove a volume

`docker volume prune` - to remove all unuased volumes

### ARGS

- available inside docker and not accesible in cmd or any application code

- applicable to image via `--build-arg`

```
ARG DEFAULT_URL = "/"

ENV URL  DEFAULT_URL
```

### ENV

- available inside dockerfile and in application code
- applicable inside container `docker run .... --env` or `docker run --env-file`

connecting a node app to mongo db will work normally via `mongodb://localhost:27017/name`

but if the app is containarize, `localhost` will not be valid ence can be resolve via `host.docker.internal` hence `mongodb://host.docker.internal:27017/name/`


## Container to Container

inspect the mongodb container `docker container inspect <name>`

obtain the IP and replace the mongodb url `mongodb://<ip>:27017/name/`
